comment.author: 71423829@N00
comment._content: Although the spelling varied at first, the name became Princes Street.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks!  Added the primary spelling for "Princes Street."

comment.author: 88364971@N00
comment._content: The street was never known as Princess Street and would only ever have been written that way in error (a common and easy mistake right enough). It was named after the sons of George III, the British monarch at the time of the New Town's construction in the 1760s. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Town,_Edinburgh

comment.author: 8521690@N02
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Literary Scotland, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 8521690@N02
comment._content: Thank you very much for your prompt addition to our pool, this is a most welcome image of considerable historical value.  I shall tag it "Sir Walter Scott" as the particular feature of interest is his monument.
